intro: Heterotaenia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. Heterotaenia is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It has a fibrous root system and can grow up to several meters in height.
